CWEs: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
description: The function does not properly sanitize the 'selector' input, which is used in the jQuery.parseHTML method. This could allow an attacker to inject malicious scripts into the web page, leading to Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks. XSS attacks can lead to a variety of security issues, including session hijacking, identity theft, and defacement of the website.
